intro: Urostigma casapiense, commonly known as the Casapiense bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and pungent odor, typical of the mustard family. Its leaves are narrow and often have a hairy texture, and it produces small, rounded pods that contain seeds. Urostigma casapiense is adapted to grow in dry, sandy soils and is often found in arid regions of its native habitat.
